intro: Gagea subtilis, commonly known as the slender gagea, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Native to the western United States, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils in woodland and meadow habitats. The plant produces small, round bulbs that serve as its primary means of reproduction. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
